text:
Mr, Tom Hall, Jr.
-2-
September 17, 1956
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The
Network distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape
recording, weekly, to members suscribing to its service. This fee Is
also based on power (with the same power classifications as membership)
and a new station does not have to pay the full fee until the third year
it is in the Network. The fees arei
$400.00
250.00
150.00
Class A
Class B
Class C
375.00
225.00
300.00
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and
from Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A
station paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over
$2.00 an hour for better than 400 hours of programming from the Network
in a year. This Is about the most inexpensive programming a station
can do.
If, after looking over the materials witch we shall send you, you have
further questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
HEH/ok
